symptoms: A long course of the disease
Severe, fixed, stabbing pain which is worse with pressure
Thickening and hardening of the articular tendons
Possible darkness or discoloration of the affected joints
Possible subcutaneous nodules on or surrounding the joint
manifestations.tongue: Purple and dark with static spots or maculae
manifestations.pulse: Soft, choppy and thready or Wiry and slippery
